intro: Hypobathrum palustre, commonly known as the marsh hound, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas in North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often growing in whorls around the stem. Hypobathrum palustre thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds.
